parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be directly linked to an officially registered campaign.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post refers to "Valeriu Iftime" and his team. While not explicitly naming a specific candidate from the list provided, the hashtags "#echipei Valeriu Iftime" and "#ValeriuIftime" strongly suggest a connection to a political campaign.  This needs further investigation to determine if Valeriu Iftime is a registered candidate for the parliamentary elections. If he is, this fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently targeting a wide audience. The use of hashtags further amplifies its reach beyond a personal communication. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's question, "Ce mesaj transmit botoșânenii #echipei Valeriu Iftime pentru Parlament? Cei vor botoșânenii în Parlamentul României pe candidații echipei #ValeriuIftime pentru a-i reprezenta?" directly aims to gauge public opinion and implicitly encourage support for Valeriu Iftime's team. This strongly suggests an electoral objective, fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c". The intent is to influence voters' choices in the parliamentary elections.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic in nature. It lacks objective reporting and instead focuses on soliciting opinions and implicitly promoting a specific political entity. It does not adhere to journalistic standards of impartiality and fact-checking.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The post is not a personal opinion; it's a structured inquiry designed to promote a political agenda. The framing of the questions is clearly intended to elicit positive responses towards Valeriu Iftime's team.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1283521692834854</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post, while not explicitly mentioning a specific candidate by name from the provided list, strongly suggests support for Valeriu Iftime and his team.  Given the targeting, hashtags, and the clear intent to influence voters' choices, it is highly likely that this constitutes electoral propaganda. The post's questions are designed to generate positive sentiment and implicitly encourage support for the team.  The paid nature of the Facebook post further strengthens this conclusion.  However, a definitive determination requires confirmation that Valeriu Iftime is a registered candidate for the parliamentary elections. If he is not, the post might still be considered political advertising, but not necessarily electoral propaganda in the context of the specific election.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate> <name>Valeriu Iftime (Team)</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Vocea Dorohoi</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Vocea Dorohoi, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul postării 1283521692834854, care promovează indirect echipa lui Valeriu Iftime,  prin întrebări sugestive menite să genereze un sentiment pozitiv și să influențeze votul alegătorilor în favoarea acestora, având ca efect electoral o creștere a popularității și a voturilor pentru echipa respectivă.  Întrebările „Ce mesaj transmit botoșânenii #echipei Valeriu Iftime pentru Parlament? Cei vor botoșânenii în Parlamentul României pe candidații echipei #ValeriuIftime pentru a-i reprezenta?” sunt clar orientate spre a influența decizia de vot, constituind astfel propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
